intro: Angolluma commutata, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. The plant is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known species such as tomatoes and potatoes. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. The fruit of Angolluma commutata is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
